The Mongolian beef wasn't too spicy and didn't come with too much meat. Additionally, I think there's supposed to be crispy noodles that come with the dish traditionally that this place eschewed. 

It was pretty decent food, although I wish it were a bit cheaper and arrived sooner. The food, while somewhat plentiful depending on the dish, was pretty decent but could be a bit more better heated.
author: Rick C.

description: A chinese restaurant that has Jarritos sodas? That's a good restaurant in my book! Had the potstickers, they were delicious :)
author: Sami Y.

description: Food took (1 hr 15 mins) to arrive. Tofu was leftover and cold. Egg Foo Young was a Huge, Greasy, Burnt disk of SH@T infested with chunky red onion and four tiny shrimp. Egg rolls were again, grease bombs with No actual filling!!. Steamed brown rice was edible. Booo.
author: Amber W.

description: This place is really under appreciated. There food is delicious and you can not beat the price. Delivery was speedy and all staff I engaged with were extremely friendly.
author: Charles T.

description: Hong Kong delights me! I love the light oil/salt and MSG free menu. The prices can't be beat for the high quality of food and large quantities. The fast free delivery is awesome, too!
author: Teresa G.

description: horrid egg rolls, bbq pork is ok, walnut shrimp is almost undercooked
author: John D.

description: Fried cheken wings are crispy,Ma por tofu and Bbq pork both  taste good! All of food I order were not  too sweet or 'oilly'. I like it!
author: Jojo F.

description:
The guy on the phone was very patient with my orders! He recommanded me strewberry cheese cake for dessert. I am very suprise that how tasty it is considering that its a Chinese resturant!! 
 
Tip: They also open till 2 am in the morning, a great place for your midnight craving!
author: Pui L.

description: Meh....not great. Three stars but then, we ordered three dish special on Grubhub. One dish was what we ordered. The other two were not. Food was luke warm and pretty bland.  No more...
author: Jeffrey O.

description: I ordered my food at 7:30pm and I got it at 08:37pm.  My order was $21.65 total with tax for the 3-dish deal.  I planned to pay him $26, but I took out $2 because the delivery took more than an hour.  Also, I ordered Seafood & Tofu Claypot, Dry Fried Flounder (whole fish) and Fermented Beancurd with On Choy, but no seafood in the Seafood & Tofu Claypot!!!  I looked at the menu after, and I think gave me the Fried Tofu with Mixed Vegetables.   Will never order from them again.
author: Crystie Nicci S.

description: The food is so good. I dont how to  find one more awsome chinese restaurant like this! The Honey Walnut Prawn is so amazing! And I like the Fish so much. I will order again and again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: George T.

description: I have never written a review in my life... I literally signed up for my own Yelp account just so I could write about just how horrible the food is from this place... Eggplant with garlic sauce = steamed eggplant pieces without any sauce at all, Singapore rice noodles = yellow tasteless glob, and Mapo tofu = some of the most tasteless, absolutely poor quality excuse for tofu I've ever had. I'm honestly NOT a picky eater, nor are my other two friends, and when the hotel front desk handed me the menu, we were excited just to eat ANYTHING. 95% of this meal went into the trash and considering how hungry the three of us were, that's saying a LOT.
author: Di G.

description: OMG, never again. I ordered my food around 9:00pm literally got it at 10:40pm not even that my totally amount was $22.00 NOT EVEN worth $22 horrible. The manager was very nice for giving me half off my total amount because my food was going to be cold & surely it wasn't warm when it arrived. The rice was stale & only ONE shrimp in the seafood "combo". Ridiculous.
author: D M.

description: Tummy troubles the next day. I should have checked Yelp before ordering from this place.
author: Patrick S.

description: These people paper your door step and never answer the phone. Food is crap. Please just stop papering my doorstep with your menus.
author: Loren S.

description: If I could give negative 5 stars, I totally would. We ordered from this place last night and it was absolutely horrible. Even though we were post-bar starving, we didn't have more than one bite of anything we ordered ~ everything was SO gross.
author: Shannon K.

description:
The Salt & Pepper Tofu was crispy, spicy and generous. 
The Sauteed Broccoli w/ Garlic was garlicy and cooked just right.
The Egg Fried Rice had a great subtle flavor and wasn't greasy.
Fast. Hot. Best Chinese delivery we've had in a while.
author: Jack M.

description:
Order Bravo Pizza Instead. This place may make you sick.

Last night after a long day at work we decided to order out Chinese to quench a craving we'd been having for a while. The food tasted of propane. Ewww.

We ordered late which was great because often we can't get food in our area that isn't pizza after 10pm.

We ordered the Beef Chow Fun and the Honey Walnut Prawns. Unfortunately I was very very disappointed by what was delivered to me. 

1. We had to call after the 45 minute window that we were given to see where our food was?? 

2. 45 minutes after that our food arrived. 1 1/2 hours WOW!

3. Our Beef Chow Fun tasted like propane. Yuck! We didn't get past the first bites. How does my food taste like propane anyway???

4. All of our food was cold. I'd get a tv dinner if I wanted to microwave my food.
5. The prawns had a great flavor but, were cold and soggy.
6. The food tasted like it sat at a gas pump for an hour before it made it to us. 

This is all very unfortunate because I could taste some really great recipes under the cold, propane infused food. 

I will be talking to grub hub and the restaurant today. I feel like I got cheated out of a good meal that I paid good money for.  :(

** Update after speaking with management: They dont care about your service. I was told that an hour and a half after being told 45 minutes is normal for them. And when they called me back to discuss the service they offered me a portion of credit for food that wasnt eaten because it was poorly made. I will actually be calling the health department re: this restaurant. Food should not taste of propane. EVER! They hung up on me when I told them that I had written a yelp review.
author: Airika A.

description:
Not having anything in the fridge to eat or the desire to cook, I decided to go ahead and give those restaurants who leaves their menus in front of my door. I had a lot of restaurants to choose from but eventually settled for Hong Kong Delights since they offered the best deal, and the prices were cheaper than the others. 

The lady I spoke on the phone with said that it was going to be a 40 min. wait but the food arrived within 30 minutes or maybe even less so that was pretty fast and the food was warm like it just came out of the kitchen. 

As happy as I was with how fast my food was delivered I can't exactly say the same about how the food tasted. I got the three dish special for $19, ordered sweet sour pork, chicken fried rice, and steak onion.

The portions were a bit small... I definitely expected a bit more.. 

The chicken fried rice was okay and it was the only dish I finished. As for the steak onion, it was a bit salty but would probably have tasted better with regular white rice. Though both weren't the best dishes or come even close to it, it did satisfied my hunger and I have tasted a lot worst so over all, the dishes were decent. However, the sweet and sour pork was just gross.. I couldn't eat it nor could my sister, it tasted weird, the texture was just completely off, not to mention the pork didn't even look like pork.. 

So!
Fast Delivery- 5 starts
Price and portion- 3 starts
Taste- 2 stars

So overall 21/2 stars- not the best but does satisfy you. 

I'm not crossing this place off of my list of restaurants to order from yet, considering I know there are worst restaurants out there and this place is not that bad. When I do, I will write a review again, and hopefully the experience will be better.
author: Arianne D.

description:
Where should I start? 
The food is not that great. Lack of flavor and too salty. Portions are small.
We ordered some beef crispy noodle and sweet and sour chicken because my son is allergic to seafood.  He ate the noodle and had immediately a  rash. This means that they cook in dirty woks. They must have cooked some shrimps and used the same wok for the beef crispy noodle. 

I did not want to go out. I did not want to cook. I did not cook and I still had to go out to buy some benadril for my son. Someone else could have died while eating a beef noodle.

Question.. If they don't even clean their dishes, what are the odds that they clean their hands after going to the bathroom? especially after the big one? Bon appetit and enjoy their food.
author: Jean-Yves F.

description: The food is ok. I do mean ok. It used to taste really good when me and my Patna ordered from here the first time. But; however, I always ask myself where can you get 3 Asian dishes for 19.95 that's a win win situation.
author: Relly P.

description: So we ordered online and got a confirmation email and everything. we placed our order in at about 1 am, at 1:45 we call and say "where the hell is our food?!?" they calmed us down and said it would be there any minute. at 2:00 we call again and they practically hang up on us, saying that they would call the driver and get back to us. its now 2:15 at this point we are very angry!! we really need to get to the bottom of this. it turns out...... they never even got our order!!!!! um hello... HAVE WE NOT BEEN CALLING YOU FOR THE PAST HOUR?!?! we're so hungry now, we dont even fight with them, we just want to place our order again. oh wait, THERE CLOSED. never ever ever ever ever ever go here.
author: Andi B.

description:
Eating it now... Starting to feel the same as others... ever since Ha's closed down, there is no good delivery in the city.

I judge Chinese delivery on two things (always): is their steamed rice hot, and can they make a decent Kung Pao Chicken?

Epic failure on both.  The rice was cold and stale, as was the rest of their food (I also got beef chow fun and lemon chicken).  

The flavor was decent on the beef chow fun and they actually didn't over sauce the lemon chicken (so kudos there), but the kung pao was terrible.  Huge slices of ginger (and um, I'm sorry... but why are you putting ginger slices in kung pao chicken?) no peanuts - literally not one, very little peppers, almost no sauce.

It also took 20 min longer for delivery then they said.  

As yelp says "Eek! Methinks not"
author: P K.

description: Ordered delivery for the 1st time today from here. It took a while to get the food delivered but in the end it was good. The steamed riced was nice and fluffy, the chow mein was amazing, the noodles were a little thicker than I'm used to but they tasted great and not generic but legit chinese noodles. The potstickers were nice and pulp and tasty as well. The orange chicken actually tasted and smelled like orange, however unlike big brand panda express orange it was moist and covered with a delicious orange tasting sauce. The food was amazing and even more amazing was the ability to order online. I see myself order more food from them in the future
author: Luis P.

description: This place is by far the worst Chinese food I've ever had!! The fried rice looked like mashed potatoes. It was so tasteless, I still can't get the fact it looked like that. DO NOT RECOMMEND!!! Then the orange chicken, it was almost as tasteless as the rice. On eat24, it said "must try". More like must pass. The beef & broccoli was horrific, the beef was tasteless. TASTELESS TASTELESS TASTELESS. When I called the restaurant, I was told that no one ever calls back to complain about the food. I talked to the manager, he 'we have hundreds of orders' & can't afford to refund or exchange the food. $30 down the drain. Makes me feel like never trying new Chinese food but I know there are places that do serve good food. Like china wok!!!!
author: Sabino R.

description: The food was dry and tasteless I called in for delivery and it took forever. On top of the they have the worst service ever! The driver was super rude and yelled at me!
author: Gabriela R.

description: The food was nasty. Egg rolls were stuffed with slimy cabbage, the "vegetarian option" contained meat, and everything was leaking all over the bag when it arrived at my house. Totally gross. Don't order from here.
author: Joni S.

description: Just ordered from here last night, it was pretty good.  We ordered the 19.95 special: Chicken Curry, Walnut Prawns and Whole Crispy Chicken.  They got here when they said they would and found my building (which is not easy).  So far, no stomach cramps!!
author: Tolbert J.

description: I ordered chicken egg rolls and I got veggie egg rolls instead. When I called to tell them, they assured me it was chicken. WTF? I'm pretty sure I can differentiate between chicken and vegtables, but yeah thanks -.-
author: Elizabeth Z.

description: I am so surprised by all of the negative reviews on this restaurant. We ordered (via delivery) the pot stickers, Mongolian beef, spicy fish with garlic and the egg foo young and totally loved the food. The food arrived promptly and was warm and tasty. Granted, we were very hungry but would order from them again based on our initial experience.
author: Diana A.

description: After waiting 1 hour and 35 minutes, the food was finally delivered. It was lukewarm so I'm not sure if they tried to keep it hot in some container. The wonton skins separated from the meat in the soup and the salt and pepper spareribs had lots of fat. The char siu had no flavor and was fatty.  I also did not get a receipt. I will never order from this place again. If you do, they charge $2.50 for delivery but they don't tell you that.
author: Teresa O.

description:
Is it impossible to find good chinese food that delivers?
Perhaps.  This isn't it.

Had people over, wanted to order in, and they had left a flyer.
Got:
Sweet and sour chicken, Spicy basil beef, Beef with chinese brocolli, Chicken Chow Mein, Honey Walnut Prawns, Crab Wontons, Egg rolls.

All very sub-par, except the egg rolls, good flavor, perfectly cooked, in the paper thin wrappers, not the thick ones.  This was the only thing to  be finished.

Again, when we want chinese, we just need to head into the city to Erics. It's just not worth it to waste our time or $ on stuff we are not going to enjoy.
author: Mom Of Three L.

description: The food is not so great but delivery is available late night if your really craving so/so Chinese food.
author: Lloyd A.

description: Get their Cantonese rice noodles and hot and sour soup!!! Really good food, fast service.
author: Kira H.

description: Two bit operation. Not too bad for the price. Dirt cheep. You get what you pay for.
author: Evan N.

description: UGH. I ordered from here because I love chow fun. I was eating it and felt a hair in my mouth, pulled it out and it was like several short black hairs (about an inch ?) attached at one end. How completely disgusting, I ran straight to the bathroom and gagged for 10 minutes. WTF was that? rat hair? eyelashes? Ew ew ew ew I can't eat any of my food now, I'm so disgusted. calling in the morning
author: Jasmine G.

description: Not out of this world but exactly what order out Chinese is supposed to be.  Cheap, big portions, tasty while hot and fast!!  No idea where these guys are but they got over in 25 min and that was perfect. I had the salt & pepper tofu, spicy fried rice and orange chicken. They were all good and I'd order them again.  The portions were huge which explains my fat ass!!!
author: Ramon L.

description: If you like half eaten chicken wings, gross salt and pepper chicken, or want to catch food poisoning this is the place to order from. I ordered from Eat24 hours and they delivered. However, what I uncovered was gross. The chicken wings looked half eaten, the salt and pepper chicken did not look fresh and had a rather funky smell to it, and the Chowmein was very oily. Not only was this a heart attack waiting to happen but it was also food poisoning at it's best. After uncovering this, I contacted Eat24 where a rep called the place. They refused to deal with my complaint and simply would not come to an agreement for a refund. Since I hadn't paid with CC, they simply said that I was the ONLY person to every complain. I highly doubt that, was my response. And what came next was rather unpleasant. The person who answered whom I believe was a girl named Katie said that I was just being picky. I said, "I will come over to you now, and I will bring the food over and watch you eat it, and you tell me if you love it"! Yeah she didn't want that either, I can tell by her stuttering. At any rate I called the SF Dept for Health and food (I'm oblivious to their name right now), but they did call me right away. They told me that this place was closed down several days ago in connection with some food violation. WOW! Imagine this. So if I have helped you shed some light on this establishment I beg that you choose carefully.
author: Pamela A.

description: I made the poor choice of ordering from this Chinese Food Delivery Restaurant and it was awful!!!!  I ordered potstickers that were burnt and very small. The orange chicken should be called orange colored sugary dried chicken. The alleged chicken chow main had three little morsels of what could have been chicken or I hope to God it was. Then the fried rice was dried and flavorless and to add insult to injury they got the order wrong, I ordered chow fun and they sent the poor excuse of chicken chow mein. It is so sad and appalling that they are still misleading customers with their false advertisement that they take the time to deliver to the northern peninsula and San Francisco. I think they should the time to improve their food, hire a decent cook before they continue to disseminate their lousy food
author: Lizzie C.

description: DO NOT ORDER HERE ! I ordered the 3 entrees for $20 . The Salt and Pepper Chicken was the only DECENT food i received . The rice was EXTREMLY salty & it only had TWO TINY shrimp in it , i called to complain and get a refund and they argued for about 30 mins sayin they would not give me my money  * back because they didnt wanna waste gas bringing it back to me . Im extremely irritated and tried to keep my composure . Finally after making a couple legal demands , they decided to bring me my money . . I will NEVER order here again .
author: Myleesa F.

description: Haters are gonna hate. But I love this place. And so did my sisters. Is this the best Chinese food on earth? Probably not. But all three items we ordered for delivery to our hotel was DELICIOUS! We got sweet and sour fish, Singapore noodles (with BBQ pork and shrimp), and the best mapo tofu!
author: Yon S.

description: Good value, esp with the 3 for 19.95 plates. One of the few places in the area that delivers that doesn't serve americanized chinese. Delivered to parkside area in about 30 minutes. Looking forward to trying more Cantonese style favorites...
author: Amina B.

description: I don't have any idea why some scores are so low for Chef Ming.  We have been exceptionally pleased with the food. Try the Spicy Basil Beef, Black Mushroom veggies,  yum
author: Leon W.

description:
I like this place because of the fact they use white meat in the chicken dishes, and it seems like the ingredients are of good quality. 

My only complaint is the sauce and flavorings, many of the dishes are just covered in orange chicken syrup of sweet and sour sauce etc... the same sauce you get at cheap places..

I did notice they have a seperate chinese menu, i will definitely have a chinese friend order for me next time and see what thats like.
author: Mark M.

description: We tried Hong Kong Delights at least 4 separate times using home delivery before deciding they deserved a solid review from some very happy customers.  Our food arrives almost immediately ( less than 30 minutes), piping hot and still obviously prepared to order.  Vegetables are fresh, al dente and flavorful.  Special requests to add chilis or Extra spices are always spot on.  We've been ordering takeout from all the usual suspects for years and this place seems to nail it every time.  Our advice is to give it a try  and tell them you saw this in Yelp, and want the same great experience.
author: Roy D.

description: So sad. Delivery tonight was probably the worst I have had in SF.  Food tasted of nothing.  Potstickers were a doughy mass.  Three veg. seemed like frozen reheated. Shrimp tasted like dirt. Which I realize happens sometimes. Unfortunately the shrimp were also tortured with basil stems. Big thick unchewable stems.  So sad sorry food. Im sad I tried to eat it. One star for the nice phone.
author: Michelle M.

description: Sometimes you just want good old fashion Chinese takeout.  The greasy, hearty and always flavorful Chinese takeout that people often so fondly talk about.  Hong Kong Delights is just that--comfort Chinese takeout food.  I got the crab rangoons, tofu mushroom veggie dish and pork fried rice.  Each order was legit, like the real stuff, no corners were cut.  Crab rangoon, good crispy texture with enough crab meat and cream cheese to satisfy yet not overwhelm.  The tofu and mushrooms? Fab.  Many places will skimp on the mushrooms but this dish had enough for me.  Finally, the pork fried rice really hit the spot.  It had good quality bbq pork (I was very surprised but pleasantly so) and the portion was generous to last me several days.  Mmmm day old Chinese takeout.  Delish.
author: Karen N.

description: Mediocre food delivered late, so lukewarm that we had to reheat it in the microwave, rendering it even more mediocre. I ordered online: mu shu vegetables (overly-salty, hardly anything but cabbage); 3-entree special of chicken/asparagus (ok), eggplant in garlic sauce  (underspiced but ok) and sauteed vegetable mixture (mushrooms good, snow peas way overcooked, canned water chestnuts); and steamed rice (hard). The website informed that most orders for delivery take 45-60 minutes. After an hour 15 minutes, I called looking for our order. I was told that it was very busy (fine, I get that), given an apology (nice, appreciated) and told the delivery person would be there in 5 minutes. Another 20 minutes passed. I was just dialing the number to cancel the order when it arrived. Lessons learned: do not order from this place; think twice about ordering online; don't pay beforehand, as it may compromise any recourse one has; always tip the delivery person.
author: Suzanne M.

description: This place is pretty amazing! I always order through grubhub and it always comes within and hour and is steaming hot.  Kung Pao Chicken and Wonton Soup - delicious! I don't understand the 1 star reviews.  I've ordered probably about 30 times in the past 6 months and every time it's the same and great!  Can't wait for it to get here again in about 15 minutes!
author: J P.

description: I ordered dinner tonight through eat 24: pepper steak, large rice, egg rolls, and 3 sodas.  I got 1 soda, pepper steak with no peppers, and meat that was just about RAW.  The egg rolls were sitting in about an inch of grease in the container and completely soggy.  It was a disgusting mess.  I placed a complaint with eat 24 and the contacted the restaurant, which authorized a credit for the 2 sodas I didn't receive and the order of pepper steak.  So, I was left with soggy egg rolls and a large rice for dinner.  Really?  What am I supposed to do with that?  And yes, go ahead and keep that $4 tip as well.....as I sit here....without dinner.  Never again!
author: Sherry S.

description: Great BBQ pork for for 4$ a pound delivered! Other stuff is not that great. Fast delivery at lunch time anyway. Good luck. Someone take pictures please!
author: Boxxxman J.

description: I will give no star. I ordered tomato beef over rice, and they gave me a fried rice. I called them and the woman told me to put the order into a bowl and there will be tomato in it. However, they send me was beef fried rice and refused to even apologize. Really bad attitude and totally impatient over phone. Hope they shut down ASAP!
author: Jeff H.

description: Oh man, this place was great the other few times we ordered from them but last time I got sick from it. They are always pleasant and quick, and the food tastes great, so I'm really sad about this! Hopefully it was a fluke but I thought I should warn people.... :(
author: gretel k.

description:
DO NOT order delivery food from here -- especially if you are a vegetarian.

My housemate and I were hoping to try a new Chinese delivery place. We live in the Mission, and Hong Kong Delights had left a delivery menu on our front door. We called, placed our order, and were told a price. Then so many things went wrong:

- Once we hung up, we realized the price was much too high. We called back, and they gave us a bullshit story about how their prices had just gone up -- despite the fact that they were cheaper on the menu they'd just left on our door, and online.

- They also charged us a delivery charge, claiming that we were just outside their range of free delivery -- again, despite the fact that they were intentionally advertising free delivery in our neighborhood.

- Given all of this price hiking, we asked them to please cancel our order. They got mad and told us the driver had already left, even though we had only placed the order a few moments before: another clear lie.

- When the order got here, the portions were small and the food mediocre.

- My dish, the sweet and sour tofu, had stray bits of pork in it. Not. Cool.

- All three of us housemates ending up feeling sick after eating. We all had very different dishes. We don't know if our food was tampered with, pumped full of MSG or what, but it was not a fun experience.

In short, DO NOT order delivery food from Hong Kong Delights. It is not a neat, yet undiscovered gem. It is a recipe for lies and sickness.
author: Bonnie R.

description: This was my first time ordering from this place, and the food was great!!  Best orange chicken I ever had,  The chow mein was also great!  The service is a little long.  Delivery came as promised, though, in an hour.  And the food was not so hot, but so what, we just popped it in the microwave and it was delicious!  I ordered from GrubHub. I will be ordering from Golden Wok SF again.  :-)
author: Irene T.

description: I GOT FOOD POISONING! This food looked/tasted like it was cooked in a microwave. It was a piece of shit.
author: Preetman S.

description:
They are in the ok range for Chinese food. I ordered through eat24 for delivery and 2 orders were wrong. I specifically said not spicy for salt and pepper fish and they put Jalapeño on the food, and the House Chow mein which I have ordered in the past a few times was made into House Spicy Chow Mein. I emailed and spoke with 24 online assistance from eat24 and they said somebody from restaurant was going to call me. Somebody called and said they were going to send a replacement salt and pepper fish so not spicy , but not chow mein as he said cook did not make it spicy and did not add anything - I told him are you kidding me there are red pepper flakes all over them and so after I got pissed off he said he will send the 2 dishes not spicy. I am still waiting right now for the food to be delivered. Anyway, I don't think I will be using eat24 and Golden Wok after today. I will just have to take my business somewhere else. They will not credit items. I don't know if I will tip the redelivery guy as I am still upset as those orders were for my kids, so I ended up cooking anyway for them from what I have in the fridge, which I was trying to avoid and could have done on the first place.
Addendum, after about an hour from the call, the delivery guy came and called me to pick up the order from his car instead of going to my doorstep. I went down from my 10 step stairs to the street and he got out of the car to give me the food. I was going to give him $2 for the redelivery but changed my mind when I had to go down and get the food on the street and skipped the tip. I gave the first delivery guy $5. That's it never again from this place.
author: Jose D.

description: very good food...fast delivery...I recommend ordering online, because ordering on the phone seems to cause confusion. but nevertheless, I am satisfied.
author: Makana Y.

description: Nasty worst resturant ever. Do not order from this place. I ordered the tomato egg there was like barely any egg just a soup of tomato sauce...The potsticker was nasty not taste, looks and taste like straight out of the freezer. The curry chicken was average at best. Our rice was the only good thing but then again how to mess up rice lol. The snapple.... it was an opened one and someone drank 1/4 of it...Never again wanted to throw up, should have just starved and ordered in the morning lol.
author: Eddie K.

description: Nice place. I was kinda skeptical at first cuz its a hole in the wall and it looks like shit from the outside. Once inside though, its pretty decent. The food was decent, nothing to get too excited over. Id probably eat here again but only if I coujldnt ind something better or closer.
author: Erik S.

description: What's wrong with this place? I got yell at by the deliver driver couse I didn't pick up his call for deliver! I already wait for 1 hours for the food already and still need to face this sh*t!! This place can go F**K yourself! Never will order from here again!!!!!
author: Kevin C.

description: Delivered all the way to potrero, quickly. Very good value. The fried rice and chow mein basically taste like Panda Express if that's what you're looking for late at night!
author: Alex R.

description:
We have yet to find a Chinese restaurant we really like that delivers to our neighborhood (Westlake), so when a new menu was slid under our door this week we decided to give it a try.

The phone order experience was good. It is nice to not be put on hold forever and have to repeat everything you say three times. THey accept credit cards by phone, and the food arrived hot and ontime (in 30 min on a Sat eve).

The crab rangoon was adequate; the potsticker about the same (why are they always so doughy in this town?).  The moo shu beef was also pretty uninteresting. While the fried rice was free with a $20 order, besides the chicken and the rice, there was little else in the dish.The star was the salt and pepper chicken wings; thus the 3rd star.   Lot of meat, just the right amount of coating, juicy, with a mild heat in the background. That one I will definitely go for again.
author: Tom C.

description:
man! make sure you read ll the fine print on the throwaway menu. they wrote it up with alot of hidden clauses. And they don't open till 2am, they close the doors @ 10. delivery only till 2. ordered anyway, since nothing is open after findind that out. haven't eaten their food, will post on anther review after i eat it. how can u in this day & age try to nicle & dime you to death on all these fine print cheats?
amendded review, I have alittle to add after my first post, the drive is kinda of goofy as to finding his target, he called & i asked him where he was, he said outside, i said ok & opened my door looking for him, he was parked 5 houses up the block, he hasn't learned that he should find his house/apt before parking his car, some advice he could use! after fuming about their hours & tricky ass menu, my order arrived. i have to say for a restaurant that opens till 2 am (delivery only after 10) pretty good food & w/o MSG! Just read the fine print/ call with questions stated in my post! To the guy who said he was charged $2.50 for delivery, I was worried so we called & yes it doesnt state that charge but it does say within 4 miles, no charge, they do a mapquest on your address & they know exactly what the mileage is. Go For It!
author: david c.

description:
I went out to get a burrito at Ethel Mae's, but upon getting there found out it was closed. Rather than trying my luck at Diala Pizza which never looked good or trying to catch the M somewhere else I wandered down Randolph St. hoping to find somewhere else to eat. While I'm new to the area I've walked down the street before and Randolph is pretty lean. Aside from the Ocean View library and the occasional convenience store there isn't much there aside from houses. Reaching the end of the street at Orizaba I was thinking about my next move and wishing that I'd just gone over to Mission instead where at least I'd have a chance to find an alternate when, upon turning the corner I found a Chinese place with a Grand Opening sign up. Taking this as fate (or more likely, a convenient coincidence) I decided to try it out.

I tried the Orange Peel Chicken and my girlfriend got the Vegetarian Delight. Both were pretty good, nothing really special, but good enough for a neighborhood place. The Vegetarian Delight had a light sauce with a strong note of ginger that didn't overpower the vegetables. The Orange Peel Chicken was crunchy and spicy, not as much orange flavor as I like, but I've always been partial to the horribly Americanized style that comes drenched in syrupy sauce (i.e. Panda Express).

All in all it's a decent enough spot to stop in if you happen to live in the area already. There's a dearth of restaurants nearby unless you head over to Mission or up to Ocean Ave. or West Portal. There's also delivery with a $10 minimum.
author: Mark S.

description: Okay I just moved into the silver terrace neighborhood and as I came home from work, this big menu was on my grill.  I knew that I'd be ordering food somewhere but I didn't want to drive to pick it up after I had a couple of beers.  Low and behold I gave this so called restaurant a call.  I ordered the 3 item special, pepper steak, basil spicy prawn, and pepper fish.  So I gave a generous 2 stars for the price and the as promised 45 minute delivery.  The food was terrible.  I didn't get sick from it it just lacked taste and the quality was poor. The fish was chewy, the beef was so overcooked it was like jerky.  The so called prawns (small size shrimp was the frozen kind) was watery and again no flavor. I cannot understand how a place stays in business with quality of food like this.  They disguise there name as "chef Ming" with the golden wok in tiny print .  I don't think this is an actual restaurant that you can pick up, I'm certain it's a shady residential house that doesn't even carry a biz license.  They should get audited, need to pay taxes like everyone else.  Overall, skip this place by all means.
author: Pedro N.

description: BEWARE!! This is golden wok, read golden woks reviews for a more information.  This place is bad.
author: Patrick F.

description: Terrible.  40 min delivery promise on a Sunday afternoon took 1.5 hours to Noe Valley.  Who the hell makes salt and pepper prawns with the full shells on so you basically peel away all the salt and pepper and shells and have left mealy shrimp with no flavor and greasy hands.  Chicken fried rice should look brown not white with anemic eerie white chicken pieces  inside and obviously veggies from a frozen packet.  Throw away the menu they left at your door and hope they never deliver another one.
author: Matt W.

description: worse chinese restaurant ever!! not only that but the service is awful!! i will not be eating here ever again. i hope they get shut down
author: Matthew O.

description: While I do love the vegetarian chow mein from this place I can definitely say it is not at all worth the trouble I went through to get it. My roommate and I ordered food from their place and first off it took them an hour and a half to deliver our food and that too because we called them an hour after they said they would be here to see what happened. They then proceeded to say oh we'll have your food their in 15 minutes. Then when I got my food I saw they had given me a chicken chow mein instead of a vegetarian chow mein(honest mistake right?). I thought so, so I called to let them know of their mistake and ask for them to replace my order(BAD IDEA!!), they refused to bring me a replacement dinner because their restaurant was "too busy"(um hi then don't have a delivery service), they offered me a store credit instead. While I was upset because I clearly still did not receive food I thought it was nice of them to give me some sort of compensation but it sadly does not end there. I called the next day to order food and discovered that I had only received a $5.00 compensation for a meal of $6.50. They said that there boss only lets them give a $5.00 compensation for all meals and i had to pay $1.50 for the meal they gave me the next day. WOW HORRIBLE SERVICE OR WHAT??? I know the food is not worth all that hassle. I now paid an extra $1.50 for food that I should have received the day before and still waited about an hour the next day to get my food.
author: Joan C.

description: Our order was confirmed for delivery in 45 minutes. Then we received an updated delivery time 15 minutes SOONER. After an hour (30 minutes after the revised delivery time) we contacted GrubHub Support. They contacted the restaurant and told us it would be another 10-15 minutes due to the weather (light rain). Finally, an hour and forty minutes after we ordered the food arrived lukewarm. Adding insult to injury, the food wasn't good before it got cold so by the time we got it was almost inedible. We through out most of what we ordered and I went to sleep hungry.
author: Jacob W.

description: im not sure whats worse  the chinese food or the pizza..neither are delightful
author: Kim R.

description: Seriously the best Chinese food I've had in a LONG time. Saw the flyer on my gate a few days ago so I thought why not give it a try and I called. Got the three for $19.95 and we got house chow mein, kung pao chicken, and honey walnut prawns. Most delivery spots have really shitty kung pao so I've basically given up, but 45 minutes later when it got to my door I devoured the whole damn order in one sitting. It was ridiculously good. No peanuts like most kung pao but I hate peanuts so that was a plus for me. Then tonight we decided to order again. We got the kung pao (obviously), as well as the beef with Chinese broccoli, and sweet and sour pork. Egg rolls, too. I've never liked sweet and sour pork but I tried my moms order and it was actually good. The beef with Chinese broccoli was super flavorful and the beef sauce wasn't thick and slimey like a lot of other places make it. The egg rolls were crispy and awesome but they were kinda oily so that's my only complaint. After laying them on a paper towel they were great though. I seriously don't understand the negative reviews because my prayers have literally been answered for a new go to spot!!!
author: Melissa C.

description: Worst customer service ever.  (Not surprised to read review citing worst sanitaion standards ever.  Or to see from the new menu that they now only do delivery and have changed their name based surely on so many bad reviews--now "Chef Ming," so beware.)  They completely botched up our delivery order, which took an hour and 15 min.'s to deliver, and when I called them to tell them that I had not been able to eat much of it because of their multiple mistakes and to ask for a refund on the dishes that had not arrived, not only did they not apologize, but they kept arguing with me and passing me on to other people, saying, "Oh, that wasn't me," or "Well, it says here you ordered something else, so I don't know what happened" (no comment on the one that was at least written down correctly.)  Finally I was told that I could be refunded on the appetizer only (egg rolls arrived instead of pot stickers) ONLY if I RETURNED the egg rolls!  (I had already explained that my toddler also was unable to eat much--it wasn't just me, the pregnant woman.)  At this point it was all I could do to tell them that they're horrible people and hang up.  I don't know how they've managed to stay in business in SF, but they shouldn'e be.
author: Rebecca C.

description: my regular place, Crazy Pepper, was closed so I tried these guys. no flavor.  even the szechuan spicy chicken was bland. truly disappointing.
author: damiana s.

description: I've only ordered delivery from here. Good Chinese food, not too greasy, big selection, big portions, inexpensive, no MSG, and they deliver. I dig it.
author: Lisa M.

description: wow i'm impressed. not only do i love their late hours, but the quality of their food is really good! and i ordered special instructions (less oil, not spicy at all) and they did it so well. the fish is like the best i've ever had! #39 fish filet w/bok choy. incredible. and the chicken for the kung pao chicken is totally high quality.
author: Tornado G.

description: This place is great!  Totally tucked away behind sfsu, for when I don't wanna drive and deal with parking they deliver free!  The food is standard Chinese food but done with less oil than usual. I really enjoyed the walnut shrimp and BBQ pork here.
author: Ben C.

description: My girlfriend and I both really enjoy this place. It is a small little place off all by itself and I assume it is family run. The food is quite good and up to par with most of the other stuff in the immediate area and more reasonably priced as well. Additionally, the people who work there are super nice and very polite. Quite good service. We would definitely recommend.
author: Clay N.
